sentences.en: After a few days, their certitude of his return had wavered.
sentences.cn: 在数天之后, 他的回返他们的确实已经动摇.

sentences.en: And the field of hacking, through losing its moral certitude, may have grown up a little.
sentences.cn: 因此, 通过丢弃自己的一些“道德”标准, 黑客的领域可能也会获得一些发展.

sentences.en: Certainly there are those who would prefer ambiguity to certitude.
sentences.cn: 当然,对于自己是否患有艾滋病,有些人宁愿让自己将信将疑,也不愿知道明确无误的结果.

sentences.en: Chained by his certitude, he is a slave; he has forfeited his freedom.
sentences.cn: 他因确信无疑而放弃自由, 因被人所左右而失去自主.

sentences.en: Doubt and certitude are subjective reactions to the evidence.
sentences.cn: 怀疑与确信都是对于证据的主观反映.

sentences.en: In this instance, the publisher is not alone in its certitude.
sentences.cn: 在这种情况下, 并非只有出版商才如此肯定.

sentences.en: L'amour craint le doute , cependant il grandit par le doute et p é rIt'souvent de la certitude.
sentences.cn: 爱情畏惧猜疑, 然而它却往往在怀疑中成长,在确信中死去.

sentences.en: The degree to which feigning certitude impressed investors.
sentences.cn: 假装相信的程度能给投资者留下深刻印象.

sentences.en: This is why he could paint so sceptically with such certitude.
sentences.cn: 这就是为什么他能够带着怀疑主义的态度作画,却又具有如此的确信.

sentences.en: We have this definite certitude that Cicippio will be freed.
sentences.cn: 我们非常肯定西西皮欧能够获释。

trans.tran_en: the state of being or feeling certain about something
